description: Schema for AWS::CodeStarConnections::Connection resource which can be used to connect external source providers with AWS CodePipeline

Tag.description: A key-value pair to associate with a resource.

Key.description: The key name of the tag. You can specify a value that is 1 to 128 Unicode characters in length and cannot be prefixed with aws:. You can use any of the following characters: the set of Unicode letters, digits, whitespace, _, ., /, =, +, and -.
Key.markdownDescription:
The key name of the tag. You can specify a value that is 1 to 128 Unicode characters in length and cannot be prefixed with aws:. You can use any of the following characters: the set of Unicode letters, digits, whitespace, _, ., /, =, +, and -. 

---

Required: Yes  
Type: String  
Minimum Length: 1  
Maximum Length: 128  
Update requires: No interruption

Value.description: The value for the tag. You can specify a value that is 0 to 256 Unicode characters in length and cannot be prefixed with aws:. You can use any of the following characters: the set of Unicode letters, digits, whitespace, _, ., /, =, +, and -.
Value.markdownDescription:
The value for the tag. You can specify a value that is 0 to 256 Unicode characters in length and cannot be prefixed with aws:. You can use any of the following characters: the set of Unicode letters, digits, whitespace, _, ., /, =, +, and -. 

---

Required: Yes  
Type: String  
Maximum Length: 256  
Update requires: No interruption

Tag.markdownDescription:
A key-value pair to associate with a resource.

---

Required: No  
Update requires: No interruption

ConnectionName.description: The name of the connection. Connection names must be unique in an AWS user account.
ConnectionName.markdownDescription:
The name of the connection. Connection names must be unique in an AWS user account.

---

Required: Yes  
Type: String  
Minimum Length: 1  
Maximum Length: 32  
Update requires: Replacement

ProviderType.description: The name of the external provider where your third-party code repository is configured. You must specify either a ProviderType or a HostArn.
ProviderType.markdownDescription:
The name of the external provider where your third-party code repository is configured. You must specify either a ProviderType or a HostArn.

---

Required: No  
Type: String  
Update requires: Replacement

HostArn.description: The host arn configured to represent the infrastructure where your third-party provider is installed. You must specify either a ProviderType or a HostArn.
HostArn.markdownDescription:
The host arn configured to represent the infrastructure where your third-party provider is installed. You must specify either a ProviderType or a HostArn.

---

Required: No  
Type: String  
Maximum Length: 256  
Pattern: arn:aws(-[\w]+)*:.+:.+:[0-9]{12}:.+  
Update requires: Replacement

Tags.description: Specifies the tags applied to a connection.
Tags.markdownDescription:
Specifies the tags applied to a connection.

---

Required: No  
Type: Array  
Update requires: No interruption

ConnectionArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the  connection. The ARN is used as the connection reference when the connection is shared between AWS services.
ConnectionArn.markdownDescription:
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the  connection. The ARN is used as the connection reference when the connection is shared between AWS services.

---

Required: No  
Type: String  
Maximum Length: 256  
Pattern: arn:aws(-[\w]+)*:.+:.+:[0-9]{12}:.+  
Update requires: No interruption

ConnectionStatus.description: The current status of the connection.
ConnectionStatus.markdownDescription:
The current status of the connection.

---

Required: No  
Type: String  
Update requires: No interruption

OwnerAccountId.description: The name of the external provider where your third-party code repository is configured. For Bitbucket, this is the account ID of the owner of the Bitbucket repository.
OwnerAccountId.markdownDescription:
The name of the external provider where your third-party code repository is configured. For Bitbucket, this is the account ID of the owner of the Bitbucket repository.

---

Required: No  
Type: String  
Minimum Length: 12  
Maximum Length: 12  
Pattern: [0-9]{12}  
Update requires: No interruption
